FuncDef:
The port-tx-enabling-delay command enables the signal sending delay function and configures the signal sending delay .
The undo port-tx-enabling-delay command disables the signal sending delay function.
By default, the signal sending delay on an interface is 0 ms, indicating that the interface sends a signal immediately after being initialized.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the delay after which an interface sends a signal after being initialized.
The value range is 0~86400000, in milliseconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You need to consider services that have been configured on the device when configuring a signal sending delay.
Only physical interfaces can be configured with signal sending delays. Logical interfaces do not support this function.
Configuring a signal sending delay does not affect an interface that has sent signals to the peer, and the configuration takes effect after the interface is initialized.
